1.name: Some Like It Hot
1.description: When two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

2.name: Ben-Hur
2.description: When a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.

3.name: North by Northwest
3.description: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies.

4.name: Sleeping Beauty
4.description: After being snubbed by the royal family, a malevolent fairy places a curse on a princess which only a prince can break, along with the help of three good fairies.

5.name: House on Haunted Hill
5.description: A millionaire offers $10,000 to five people who agree to be locked in a large, spooky, rented house overnight with him and his wife.

6.name: Rio Bravo
6.description: A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a cripple, a drunk, and a young gunfighter in his efforts to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy.

7.name: Darby O'Gill and the Little People
7.description: A wily old codger matches wits with the King of the Leprechauns and helps play matchmaker for his daughter and the strapping lad who has replaced him as caretaker.

8.name: Anatomy of a Murder
8.description: In a murder trial, the defendant says he suffered temporary insanity after the victim raped his wife. What is the truth, and will he win his case?

9.name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
9.description: An Edinburgh professor and assorted colleagues follow an explorer's trail down an extinct Icelandic volcano to the earth's center.

10.name: Count Your Blessings
10.description: Grace hastily marries a French aristocrat during WWII, but is separated by circumstance from him for almost nine years. And when reunited, Charles's philandering causes them to divorce and ...                See full summary »

11.name: The 39 Steps
11.description: In London, a diplomat accidentally becomes involved in the death of a British agent who's after a spy ring that covets British military secrets.

12.name: Les quatre cents coups
12.description: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.

13.name: The Mummy
13.description: In 1895, British archaeologists find and open the tomb of Egyptian Princess Ananka with nefarious consequences.

14.name: Plan 9 from Outer Space
14.description: Evil aliens attack Earth and set their terrible "Plan 9" in action. As the aliens resurrect the dead of the Earth to destroy the living, our lives are in danger.

15.name: Operation Petticoat
15.description: During World War II, a commander finds himself stuck with a decrepit (and pink) submarine, a con man executive officer, and a group of army nurses.

16.name: Carry on Teacher
16.description: Pupils run amok at Maudlin Street School in an attempt to hang on to their headmaster. He has applied for a new job, but the students like him and don't want to lose him. They concoct a ...                See full summary »

17.name: On the Beach
17.description: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.

18.name: Imitation of Life
18.description: An aspiring actress befriends a black widow, but trouble arises when the latter is rejected by her daughter, who tries to pass for white.

19.name: The Tingler
19.description: An obsessed pathologist discovers and captures a parasitic creature that grows when fear grips its host.

20.name: Suddenly, Last Summer
20.description: The only son of wealthy widow Violet Venable dies while on vacation with his cousin Catherine. What the girl saw was so horrible that she went insane; now Mrs. Venable wants Catherine lobotomized to cover up the truth.

21.name: Pillow Talk
21.description: A man and a woman who share a party line cannot stand each other, but he has fun romancing her with his voice disguised.

22.name: The Diary of Anne Frank
22.description: During World War II, a teenage Jewish girl named Anne Frank and her family are forced into hiding in the Nazi-occupied Netherlands.

23.name: Das indische Grabmal
23.description: A German architect runs away with the maharajah of Eschnapur's fiancee but is caught and thrown in the dungeon, while his relatives arrive from Europe looking for him and the maharajah's brother is scheming to usurp the throne.

24.name: Porgy and Bess
24.description: A woman whose past is scorned by nearly everyone around her meets a man who'd love her regardlessly- if only everyone else would allow them to.

25.name: The Sound and the Fury
25.description: Drama focusing on a family of Southern aristocrats who are trying to deal with the dissolution of their clan and the loss of its reputation, faith, fortunes and respect.

26.name: The Wild and the Innocent
26.description: In Wyoming, mountain trapper Yancy goes to the nearest town to trade his pelts but gets into trouble when he tries to save runaway saloon girl Rosalie from her shameful job.

27.name: The Horse Soldiers
27.description: In 1863, a Union outfit is sent behind Confederate lines in Mississippi to destroy enemy railroads but a captive southern belle and the unit's doctor cause frictions within ranks.

28.name: Hiroshima mon amour
28.description: A French actress filming an anti-war film in Hiroshima has an affair with a married Japanese architect as they share their differing perspectives on war.

29.name: I'm All Right Jack
29.description: A naive aristocrat in search of a career becomes caught up in the struggles between his profit-minded uncle and an aggressive labor union.

30.name: Warlock
30.description: A famous gunman becomes the marshal of Warlock to end a gang's rampages, but is met with some opposition by a former gang member turned deputy sheriff who wants to follow only legal methods.

31.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
31.description: When a nobleman is threatened by a family curse on his newly inherited estate, detective Sherlock Holmes is hired to investigate.

32.name: The Wasp Woman
32.description: A scientist develops a youth formula for a cosmetics queen from jelly taken from queen wasps, failing to anticipate the typical horrible side effects.

33.name: The Siege of Pinchgut
33.description: An escaped prisoner is trying to clear his name.

34.name: Room at the Top
34.description: An ambitious young accountant plots to wed a wealthy factory owner's daughter, despite falling in love with a married older woman.

35.name: The Nun's Story
35.description: After leaving a wealthy Belgian family to become a nun, Sister Luke struggles with her devotion to her vows during crisis, disappointment, and World War II.

36.name: Pickpocket
36.description: Michel is released from jail after serving a sentence for thievery. His mother dies and he resorts to pickpocketing as a means of survival.

37.name: Return of the Fly
37.description: Philippe Delambre, the now-adult son of "The Fly", does some transportation experimentation of his own.

38.name: A Bucket of Blood
38.description: A dim-witted busboy finds acclaim as an artist for a plaster-covered dead cat that is mistaken as a skillful statuette. The desire for more praise soon leads to an increasingly deadly series of works.

39.name: Solomon and Sheba
39.description: After becoming king of ancient Israel, Solomon faces threats coming from his jealous dispossessed brother Adonijah, the Egyptian Pharaoh and the scheming Queen of Sheba.

40.name: Pork Chop Hill
40.description: During the Korean War peace talks, U.S. troops fight to retake a hill from the Communist Chinese forces.

41.name: Ohayô
41.description: Two boys begin a silence strike to press their parents into buying them a television set.

42.name: Day of the Outlaw
42.description: Blaise Starrett is a rancher at odds with homesteaders when outlaws hold up the small town. The outlaws are held in check only by their notorious leader, but he is diagnosed with a fatal wound and the town is a powder keg waiting to blow.

43.name: Gidget
43.description: A young girl discovers surfing and love (in that order) during one transitive summer.

44.name: Ningen no jôken
44.description: A Japanese pacifist, unable to face the dire consequences of conscientious objection, is transformed by his attempts to compromise with the demands of war-time Japan.

45.name: They Came to Cordura
45.description: An army major, himself guilty of cowardice, is asked to recommend soldiers for the Congressional Medal of Honor during the Mexican Border Incursion of 1916.

46.name: A Summer Place
46.description: A self-made businessman rekindles a romance with a former flame while their two teenage children begin a romance of their own with drastic consequences for both couples.

47.name: The Bat
47.description: A crazed killer known as "The Bat" is on the loose in a mansion full of people.

48.name: Too Many Crooks
48.description: Accident-prone Fingers runs a pretty unsuccessful gang. They try and rob wealthy but tricky Billy Gordon - who distrusts banks and fears the Inland Revenue - but he sees Fingers and the ...                See full summary »

49.name: 4D Man
49.description: A scientist discovers a formula enabling him to pass through solid surfaces, but he also rapidly ages, which forces him to kill humans in order to reverse the aging process by absorbing his victims' energies.

50.name: The Giant Gila Monster
50.description: A giant lizard terrorizes a rural Texas community and a heroic teenager attempts to destroy the creature.
